body.p:
Woodstock Pulaski County Ky ^Jan 15th 1861^
To His Excellency
Beriah Magoffin Gov, of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

your petitioner Rufus Pearce would Respectfully State that he together with others were tried on the 15th alt,, for disturbing the peace, and your petitioner was find $15,00, and cost, your petitioner states he is a very poor man a new beginner In the world, and has not possibly any thing to Spare to pay Said fine and wishes not to be Imprisoned for Same, he therefore prays your Excellency to Interpose In his behalf and Remit or at least grant him a respite of Said fine

I E. E. Barron and acting Justice of the peace for the County of Pulaski & State of Kentuky would Respectfully State that I presided on the trial of Rufus Pearce & others there was nothing proven against him more thatn he disputed the word of a trustee of the school and Stated the School had not been taught agreable to law
there Seemed to be a good deal of prejudice against the parties there was counsel against them and none for them they are very Industrious people feeling It due to Mr Pearce to Say this much I close

we the following named Signers fully concur In the Statement of E. E. Barron J P and would Respectfully ask your
Interposition In behalf of Mr Pearce and Remit Said fine or at least grant him a Respite of Said fine

W,, W Adam
Jonas Sutton
Jackson Sutton
Wm H, Colyer
C, Greer
Martin Vanhook

Pulaski J. P.
$15. } Breach
R. Pierce
Issd Jany 22 1861
